intro: Lamium album subsp. album, commonly known as white dead-nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe, western Asia, and northern Africa. It features opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture and produces clusters of small, white, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and thrives in moist, shady environments. It is often found in woodlands, along stream banks, and in garden settings. The species is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
